meanings.definition: The action of dilating or stretching
meanings.sent1: The dilatations of the balloon made it expand rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The dilatations of the pupil in the dark allow more light to enter the eye.
meanings.sent3: The dilatations of the rubber band were so extreme that it popped with a loud sound.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter caused dilatations of joy in everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The dilatations of the riverbanks during the flood changed the landscape dramatically.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming wider or larger
meanings.sent1: The dilatations of the road were necessary to accommodate more traffic.
meanings.sent2: The dilatations of the waistline after a big meal are quite common.
meanings.sent3: The dilatations of the balloon animal made it look like a strange creature.
meanings.sent4: The dilatations of the city over the years have transformed it into a bustling metropolis.
meanings.sent5: The dilatations of the flower petals in the morning sun were a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A medical procedure to expand or open a passage in the body
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed dilatations on the patient's arteries to improve blood flow.
meanings.sent2: The dilatations of the esophagus helped the patient swallow more easily.
meanings.sent3: During the dilatations, the patient felt a strange sensation but no pain.
meanings.sent4: The dilatations of the airways allowed the patient to breathe more freely.
meanings.sent5: The successful dilatations of the blocked vein saved the patient's life.
